required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of the Glucodynamic Effects of Dulaglutide (LY2189265) in Japanese Participants With Type 2 Diabetes
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 4 Study to Evaluate Glucodynamic Effects of Dulaglutide in Japanese Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the glucodynamic effects of dulaglutide in Japanese participants with type 2 diabetes mellitus.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Glucose Area Under the Concentration Versus Time Curve From Time Zero to 4 Hours (AUC[0-4h])
primary_outcome.description: Least square (LS) means of glucose AUC 0-4h change from baseline was calculated using mixed-effects linear model. The model will include treatment, sequence, period, week, and treatment-by-week as fixed effects, baseline as a covariate, and participant as random effect.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Fasting Blood Glucose
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in fasting blood glucose obtained at pre-meal.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Postprandial Blood Glucose
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in postprandial blood glucose at 120 minutes at week 4.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Insulin Area Under the Concentration Versus Time Curve From Time Zero to 4 Hours (AUC [0-4h])
secondary_outcome.description: LS mean of the insulin change from baseline was analyzed using a mixed-effects linear model. The model includes treatment, sequence, period, week and treat-by-sequence as fixed effects, baseline as a covariate and participant as random effect.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in C-Peptide Area Under the Concentration Versus Time Curve From Time Zero to 4 Hours (AUC [0-4h])
secondary_outcome.description: LS mean of C-peptide change from baseline was analyzed using a mixed-effects linear model. The model includes treatment, sequence, period, week and treat-by-sequence as fixed effects, baseline as a covariate and participant as random effect.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Glucagon Area Under the Concentration Versus Time Curve From Time Zero to 4 Hours (AUC [0-4h])
secondary_outcome.description: LS mean of glucagon change from baseline was analyzed using a mixed-effects linear model. The model includes treatment, sequence, period, week and treat-by-sequence as fixed effects, baseline as a covariate and participant as random effect.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Triglyceride Area Under the Concentration Versus Time Curve From Time Zero to 4 Hours (AUC [0-4h])
secondary_outcome.description: LS mean of triglyceride change from baseline was analyzed using a mixed-effects linear model. The model includes treatment, sequence, period, week and treat-by-sequence as fixed effects, baseline as a covariate and participant as random effect.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Develop Hypoglycemic Events
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants who develop hypoglycemic events.

arm_group.description: Dulaglutide 0.75 mg administered subcutaneously (SC) once weekly for 4 weeks in period 1 followed by placebo administered SC once weekly for 4 weeks in Period 2. There is a 4 to 6 week washout period between Period 1 and Period 2.

Placebo administered SC once weekly for 4 weeks in Period 1 followed by Dulaglutide 0.75 mg administered SC for 4 weeks in Period 2. There is a 4 to 6 week washout period between Period 1 and Period 2.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Have type 2 diabetes (based on the World Health Organization [WHO] diagnostic criteria) for at least 1 year.
- Have diet and exercise therapy only (no oral antihyperglycemic medication for at least 3 months prior to screening).
- Have a fasting blood glucose value of ≥120 and ≤200 milligrams per deciliter (mg/dL) at screening.
- Have a screening body weight of ≥50 and ≤80 kilograms.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Have known allergies to dulaglutide, or other glucagon-like peptide-1 (GLP-1) receptor agonists.
- Have had a clinically significant cardiovascular disease.
- Have a known clinically significant gastric emptying abnormality or have undergone gastric bypass surgery or restrictive bariatric surgery.
- Have acute or chronic hepatitis, signs and symptoms of any other liver disease.
- Have a history of chronic pancreatitis or acute idiopathic pancreatitis, or were diagnosed with any type of acute pancreatitis.
- Have an estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) <30 milliliters/minute/1.73 meter squared.
- In the opinion of the investigator or sponsor, are unsuitable for inclusion in the study.

overall_official.last_name: Call 1-877-CTLILLY (1-877-285-4559) or 1-317-615-4559 Mon - Fri 9 AM - 5 PM Eastern time (UTC/GMT - 5 hours, EST)

facility.name: For additional information regarding investigative sites for this trial, contact 1-877-CTLILLY (1-877-285-4559, 1-317-615-4559) Mon - Fri from 9 AM to 5 PM Eastern Time (UTC/GMT - 5 hours, EST), or speak with your personal physician.

patient_data.ipd_description: Anonymized individual patient level data will be provided in a secure access environment upon approval of a research proposal and a signed data sharing agreement.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data are available 6 months after the primary publication and approval of the indication studied in the US and EU, whichever is later. Data will be indefinitely available for requesting.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: A research proposal must be approved by an independent review panel and researchers must sign a data sharing agreement.

group.title: Dulaglutide Then Placebo
group.description: Dulaglutide 0.75 milligrams (mg) administered subcutaneously (SC) once weekly for 4 weeks in Period 1 followed by placebo administered SC once weekly for 4 weeks in period 2. There is a 4 to 6 week washout period between Period 1 and Period 2.

group.title: Placebo Then Dulaglutide
group.description: Placebo administered SC once weekly for 4 weeks in Period 1 followed byDulaglutide 0.75 mg administered SC once weekly for 4 weeks in Period 2. There is a 4 to 6 week washout period between Period 1 and Period 2.

milestone.title: Received One Dose of Study Drug

baseline.population: All participants who received at least one dose of study drug.

group.title: Overall
group.description: Participants were randomized to one of two treatment sequences: Dulaglutide 0.75 mg administered subcutaneously (SC) in Period 1 and placebo administered SC in Period 2 or placebo administered SC in Period 1 and Dulaglutide 0.75 mg administered in Period 2.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Glucose Area Under the Concentration Versus Time Curve From Time Zero to 4 Hours (AUC[0-4h])
outcome.description: Least square (LS) means of glucose AUC 0-4h change from baseline was calculated using mixed-effects linear model. The model will include treatment, sequence, period, week, and treatment-by-week as fixed effects, baseline as a covariate, and participant as random effect.
outcome.population: All participants who receive at least one dose of study drug and have evaluable pharmacodynamic data.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
